plugins.name: Spacing Token Generator
plugins.description:
üîß What It Does

This Figma plugin helps you automatically generate spacing Tokens based on your preferred scale. Whether you're working with a base-4 or base-8 spacing system‚Äîor even a custom multiplier‚Äîthis tool creates a clean, structured set of spacing tokens to integrate into your design system.



‚öôÔ∏è How It Works


1. Choose Your Base Grid

Start by selecting your preferred spacing grid:

- 4pt scale (perfect for tighter systems)

- 8pt scale (industry standard for scalable design systems)

- Or choose the "Custom" option to set your own base multiplier (e.g., 5, 10, etc.)


2. Add Multipliers

Define the multipliers you want to generate tokens for.

You can:

- Use the default multipliers (e.g., 1x, 2x, 3x...)

- Add your own custom multipliers for more control over your spacing structure.



3. Generate Spacing Tokens

Click "Generate" and the plugin will automatically:

- Create a new variable collection called "Spacing"

- Generate a full set of iTokens (Figma variables) based on your chosen base and multipliers

- Structure them cleanly and consistently for immediate use across your components


üöÄ Why Use It?

- ‚úÖ Save time on repetitive token creation

- ‚úÖ Maintain consistency across your design system

- ‚úÖ Scale your UI spacing logic with precision

- ‚úÖ Easily integrate into Design Tokens pipelines or handoff processes
plugins.tagline: Generate spacing Tokens instantly, right inside Figma.

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


üî• Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


üöÄ How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


üöß Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


üéÅ Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


ü§ù License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


üíé Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ‚ÄùGenerate Keywords‚Äù and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I‚Äôd love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... üòÜ


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Creator
plugins.description:
Typography Style Guide Creator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers streamline their typography workflow by automatically generating text styles from existing designs. Stop manually recreating text styles and let this plugin do the heavy lifting.

With Typography Style Guide Creator, you can transform any frame containing text elements into a complete typography system that's integrated directly into your Figma styles. Simply select a frame with your text designs, run the plugin, and watch as your typography system comes to life.

Key Features


Instant Style Generation: Convert manually created text elements into reusable Figma text styles with one click

Smart Name Recognition: Uses your text layer names as style names for better organization

Duplicate Detection: Intelligently identifies and merges duplicate styles to keep your design system clean

Visual Style Preview: See all created styles in an intuitive interface before applying them

Seamless Integration: Styles are added directly to your Figma document's style library


How It Works


Select a Frame: Choose any frame containing your text elements

Name Your Layers: Ensure text layers have descriptive names (e.g., "Heading/H1", "Body/Regular")

Run the Plugin: Click "Create Styles" to generate your typography system

Done!: Your text styles are now available in your Figma document


Perfect For


Design teams establishing consistent typography systems

Designers converting existing designs into organized style guides

Design system maintainers looking to formalize typography rules

Anyone who wants to save time on manual style creation


Save Hours of Design Work

Typography Style Guide Creator eliminates the tedious process of manually creating and managing text styles. What would normally take hours can now be done in seconds, allowing you to focus on what matters most‚Äîdesigning great experiences.
plugins.tagline: Turn your text designs into organized typography styles with a single click

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome üôè


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary‚Äôs powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

plugins.name: Source DS Utils
plugins.description:
Bunch of utilities for Source Design System and Source Foundation plugin. I feel like these automations can be useful for everyone who designs in Figma.


This is a UI-less plugin that uses Figma quick actions to run automations.


Export component templates

Select components or frames with components and run the command to copy all these components as frames. You can use these copies to import component templates back.


Import component templates

Select a frame with exported component templates and run the command. This command will either replace target component content with the contents of the template or it will merge layers


Fix layers

Sometimes Figma does not resize absolutely positioned layers when you update something rapidly. When you spot such rouge layers went off you can fix them with this automation.


This command finds all absolutely positioned layers inside auto layout frames and snaps their size back to fit the parent.


Create color Styles

This command will create colour styles that are bound to the variables of the same name.


Clone component

Effortlessly clone any component or component set. When you copy/paste a simple component with lots of properties Figma creates a component instance. This automation creates an identical copy with all the properties available.


Make local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance inside another component, creates a local copy of that instance, makes it a component and swaps it with that component.


Slot to local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance, checks instance swap properties and enables you to swap it with newly created component. Lear more here -> https://forum.figma.com/t/slot-component-workflow-plugin/93749


Update Elevation Components

This is Source Design System specific automation. It reads effect styles and updates custom-made elevation components to match effect shadows.


Set Playground

Mark any file as Source Foundation Playground. This plugin uses figma.root.setPluginData method from plugin API to toggle 'SDSPlayground' property.
plugins.tagline: Automations for Source Design system

plugins.name: I18n exporter
plugins.description:
Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma


Transform your text variables into JSON format required by i18n libraries for language translations directly within Figma!


How It Works

Prepare Your Variables: Ensure your variable collections are correctly named i18n in Figma. This is crucial for the plugin to identify and process the variables meant for internationalization.


Fetch Variables: Click on the Get Variables button to automatically fetch and transform your project's i18n variables into a structured JSON format.


View and Copy: The plugin conveniently displays your variables in a tabbed interface, organized by language. Simply select the desired language tab to view the JSON output. Use the copy button to copy the JSON to your clipboard for easy integration into your i18n workflow.


Clear JSON: Want to start over or clean up? Click Clear JSON to reset the output area.


Features

Easy-to-use Interface: A user-friendly UI with a tabbed display allows for seamless navigation and operation.

Efficient Variable Conversion: Quickly converts your Figma text variables into i18n-compatible JSON.

Flexible Copy Options: Copy individual languages or the entire JSON output with a single click.


Getting Started

To get started, ensure your variable collections within Figma are named i18n. This naming convention is essential for the plugin to recognize and process your text variables for translation. Once set up, click on the Get Variables button to convert and view your variables in JSON format.


Whether you're developing multilingual designs or working on international projects, this plugin simplifies the translation process by seamlessly integrating with your i18n libraries.


Enhance your design workflow and embrace global accessibility with the Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma.


Note: This plugin is an independent tool designed to facilitate the conversion of text variables to JSON for i18n libraries. It is not an official i18n plugin or affiliated with any official i18n library developers.
plugins.tagline: I18n exporter

plugins.name: DSekon Auto Layout
plugins.description:
The plugin moves the elements to the next line AUTOMATICALLY.


  1.  Launch the plugin. The UI panel opens.
  2. Select a bunch of items.
  3. Use button ‚Äú+‚Äù to create an adaptive auto layout.
  4. Change the frame width.
  5. The elements will be rearranged automatically (The elements will also be rebuilt when the elements inside the frame are changed, except for deletion).


IMPORTANT: To automatically rearranged the elements, the UI panel must be open.


The plugin has the ability to sort the elements inside the frame in alphabetical order.


DSekon.com

Donate

Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

plugins.name: Rastarizer
plugins.description:
Rastarizer simplifies your workflow by converting Figma frames, components, and instances into optimized raster images. Simply add "-x" to the name of any frame, component, or instance you want to include in the conversion. Your originals remain intact and are only hidden during the process - easily restored with a single click. Perfect for preparing slides for PDF export or creating static versions of your designs.


Features include:

  1. One-click conversion of frames, components, and instances to images
  2. Adjustable resolution (1x to 3x)
  3. Automatic size optimization
  4. Easy toggle between original and rasterized versions
  5. Progress tracking for batch processing
  6. Non-destructive workflow (originals preserved)


Disclaimer: This plugin is provided "as is" without any warranties. The developer is not responsible for any issues that may arise from its use. Users are advised to maintain backups of their work.
plugins.tagline: Convert frames, components, and instances to high-quality raster images with a single click

plugins.name: TokenKebab Converter
plugins.description:
Purpose

This Figma plugin is designed to facilitate a smoother transition between design and development stages, particularly for those utilizing the Tokens Studio and EightShapes in their design system workflow.

Key Functionality

  • Typography Token Transformation:
  • Converts typography tokens defined in dot notation (e.g., typography.Body.Bold) into an appropriate Sass mixin structure (e.g., @include fontStyle(body-bold);).
  • Kebab-Case Conversion:
  • Transforms tokens, including those related to spacing (e.g., spacing.150), into a kebab-case format, ensuring consistency and CSS-friendly naming conventions (e.g., spacing-150).
  • Theme Prefixing:
  • Automatically prefixes theme-related tokens with "light-", changing, for instance, theme.input.border.default to light-theme-input-border-default.

In essence, the plugin programmatically refactors design tokens, enhancing their usability and implementability in CSS/Sass codebases, and ensuring a coherent and systematic naming convention throughout the design-to-development handoff process.
plugins.tagline: Ensuring Consistency from Design Tokens to Implementation

plugins.name: Perceptually Uniform Gradients
plugins.description:
By default, Figma can generate some gradients that get really muddy as they transition from color to color. With this plugin you can generate gradients using color models which handle interpolation better, which translates to more beautiful gradients.


Features:

  1. Generate gradients in Lab, OKLCH, or LCH and insert them into your Figma files as a continuous gradient or as individual, evenly-spaced stops
  2. Extract key colors from your current selection
  3. Copy raw text color scales out of the plugin in JSON format
  4. Generate multi-hue gradients
  5. Automatically correct the lightness distributions of your gradients
  6. Generate bezier-curved gradients in the Lab color space
  7. Adjust the gamma distribution of your gradients
  8. Select colors from a curated library of options
  9. Drag and drop to reorder colors
plugins.tagline: Generate more beautiful gradients by interpolating them with perceptually uniform color models.

plugins.name: Path Arrows
plugins.description:
Easily create clear visual connections between objects in your interface using arrows ‚Äî fast, simple, and without any manual work. This plugin is perfect for showcasing screen transitions, button interactions, and other UI element relationships.


Here‚Äôs how it works:


1. Select the first object (the starting point of the arrow).

2. Then select the second object (the destination).

3. Choose the sides for connection (e.g., left to right or top to bottom).

4. Click the button ‚Äî the plugin will automatically draw a clean arrow between the two.


It‚Äôs a quick and intuitive way to map out user flows, demonstrate interactions, or organize your layout visually


This is the MVP version ‚Äî more updates are on the way. Your feedback means a lot!
